  • Method Details

    • isFirstSignIn

      public boolean isFirstSignIn()
      Checks if the user is signing in for the first time by checking if the current user from FirebaseAuth is null.
      Returns:
      true if it's the first sign in, false otherwise

    • getCurrentUserUid

      public String getCurrentUserUid()
      Gets the unique ID (UID) of the current user from FirebaseAuth.
      Returns:
      the UID of the current user

    • createAnonymousUser

      public com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<com.google.firebase.auth.AuthResult> createAnonymousUser()
      Creates an anonymous user in FirebaseAuth, allowing users to use the app without creating an account. You can use the returned Task to attach listeners and handle success or failure.
      Returns:
      a Task that represents the asynchronous sign in operation

    • addUser

      public com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<Void> addUser(User user)
      Adds a new user to Firestore. This operation is asynchronous and returns a Task. You can use the returned Task to attach listeners and handle success or failure.
      Parameters:
      user - the user to be added
      Returns:
      a Task that will be completed once the user is added

    • updateUser

      public com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<Void> updateUser(User user)
      Updates an existing user in Firestore. it is asynchronous and returns a Task. You can use the returned Task to attach listeners and handle success or failure.
      Parameters:
      user - the user with updated information
      Returns:
      a Task that will do things once the user is updated

    • deleteUser

      public com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<Void> deleteUser(String userId)
      Deletes a user from Firestore.
      Parameters:
      userId - the ID of the user to be deleted
      Returns:
      a Task that will be completed once the user is deleted

    • getUsers

      public com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<List<User>> getUsers()
      Retrieves all users from Firestore.
      Returns:
      a Task that will be completed after list is fetched

    • continueGetUsers

      public com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<List<User>> continueGetUsers(String lastUserId)

    • getUser

      public com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<User> getUser(String userId)
      Retrieves specific user from Firestore.
      Parameters:
      userId - the ID of the user to retrieve
      Returns:
      a Task that will be completed once user is fetched

    • getUserTask

      public com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<com.google.firebase.firestore.DocumentSnapshot> getUserTask(String userId)
      Retrieves specific user from Firestore. The difference is this one returns a task instead of user object
      Parameters:
      userId - the ID of the user to retrieve
      Returns:
      a Task holding a snapshot of the document

    • getUserByImageURL

      public com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<User> getUserByImageURL(String imageURL)
